description:
## KEDA

KEDA (Kubernetes Event-Driven Autoscaling) is an open-source project that enables Kubernetes workloads to scale dynamically based on event-driven metrics from sources like message queues, databases, or cloud services.

This KEDA dashboard provides real-time visual insights into scaling activity, queue depths, and trigger metrics, helping users monitor and optimize their autoscaling behavior effectively.

**Further reading:**

- [Datadog KEDA Integration Documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/integrations/keda/)
- [KEDA Docs](https://keda.sh/docs/latest/concepts/)
- [KEDA Monitoring Docs](https://keda.sh/docs/latest/integrations/prometheus/)
title: KEDA Overview

definition.content:
KEDA (Kubernetes Event-Driven Autoscaling) is an open-source project that enables Kubernetes workloads to scale dynamically based on event-driven metrics from sources like message queues, databases, or cloud services. 

This KEDA dashboard provides real-time visual insights into scaling activity, queue depths, and trigger metrics, helping users monitor and optimize their autoscaling behavior effectively.
KEDA Overview shows a quick summary of all reporting KEDA instances and related monitors and their status.

Scaler-related metrics help monitor the performance of KEDA's scaling logic, including trigger activity, scaled objects, and scaler errors, providing an overview of scaling efficiency and performance.
Controller metrics provide visibility into KEDA's internal processing, including workqueue depth and performance, helping to identify bottlenecks or delays in scaling operations.

definition.title: Unfinished Work in Work Queue Duration
Average Work Queue Item Processing Time
Average Item in Work Queue Time Before Processing

definition.content: The internal metric service tracks KEDA’s own health and metrics collection, helping troubleshoot performance issues or bottlenecks.
